ArticleTitle.sentence: Stat6 inhibits human interleukin-4 promoter activity in T cells.

event.clue: Stat6 inhibits human interleukin-4 promoter activity in T cells.

AbstractText.sentence: The differentiation of naive T-helper (Th) cells into cytokine-secreting effector Th cells requires exposure to multiple signals, including exogenous cytokines.

event.clue: The differentiation of naive T-helper (Th) cells into cytokine-secreting effector Th cells requires exposure to multiple signals, including exogenous cytokines.

AbstractText.sentence: Interleukin-4 (IL-4) plays a major role in this process by promoting the differentiation of IL-4-secreting Th2 cells.

AbstractText.sentence: In Th2 cells, IL-4 gene expression is tightly controlled at the level of transcription by the coordinated binding of multiple transcription factors to regulatory elements in the proximal promoter region.

AbstractText.sentence: Nuclear factor of activated T cell (NFAT) family members play a critical role in regulating IL-4 transcription and interact with up to five sequences (termed P0 through P4) in the IL-4 promoter.

AbstractText.sentence: The molecular mechanisms by which IL-4 induces expression of the IL-4 gene are not known, although the IL-4-activated transcription factor signal transducer and activator of transcription 6 (Stat6) is required for this effect.

AbstractText.sentence: We report here that Stat6 interacts with three binding sites in the human IL-4 promoter by electrophoretic mobility shift assays.

event.clue: We report here that Stat6 interacts with three binding sites in the human IL-4 promoter by electrophoretic mobility shift assays.

AbstractText.sentence: These sites overlap the P1, P2, and P4 NFAT elements.
To investigate the role of Stat6 in regulating IL-4 transcription, we used Stat6-deficient Jurkat T cells with different intact IL-4 promoter constructs in cotransfection assays.

AbstractText.sentence: We show that, whereas a multimerized response element from the germline IgE promoter was highly induced by IL-4 in Stat6-expressing Jurkat cells, the intact human IL-4 promoter was repressed under similar conditions.

event.clue: We show that, whereas a multimerized response element from the germline IgE promoter was highly induced by IL-4 in Stat6-expressing Jurkat cells, the intact human IL-4 promoter was repressed under similar conditions.

AbstractText.sentence: We conclude that the function of Stat6 is highly dependent on promoter context and that this factor promotes IL-4 gene expression in an indirect manner.
